intro: Paronychia desertorum, commonly known as the desert sandmat, is a flowering plant native to arid regions of the southwestern United States and northwestern Mexico. It is a low-growing perennial herb characterized by its dense, mat-forming growth habit and hairy stems. The plant produces small, white or pinkish flowers in clusters during the spring and summer months. Its leaves are narrow, linear, and often covered in fine hairs, which help reduce water loss in dry environments. Paronychia desertorum is well adapted to harsh desert conditions, making it a resilient and hardy species.
